title: 109_hr5778
content: The "Coal-to-Liquid Fuel Energy Act of 2006" defines coal-to-liquid fuel as any liquid fuel derived from coal through the Fischer-Tropsch process. The Act also establishes a loan guarantee program for large-scale coal-to-liquid fuel facilities. The Secretary will establish a program providing loans up to $20,000,000 for eligible recipients to cover costs for planning, permitting, and constructing coal-to-liquid fuel facilities producing at least 10,000 barrels per day. Owners or operators must submit an application meeting specified requirements to receive a loan, with a non-Federal match required. To be eligible for a loan under this program, recipients must provide a dollar-for-dollar match with non-Federal funds. Repayment of the loan must be made within 5 years, and can come from any financing received for the coal-to-liquid fuel facility construction. Authorization of $200,000,000 for this section, available until expended. SEC. 5. STRATEGIC PETROLEUM RESERVE. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to include a study on maintaining coal-to-liquid fuel products in the Reserve. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to include coal-to-liquid fuel products in the Reserve, not to exceed 20 percent of total petroleum products. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to include coal-to-liquid fuel products in the Reserve, limited to 20 percent of total petroleum products. Amendments include redesignating paragraphs and subsections for conformity. Extension of excise tax credits for liquid fuel derived from coal. Extension of excise tax credits for liquid fuel derived from coal, with amendments to paragraphs in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the termination date to December 31, 2020 for certain sales or uses involving liquid fuel derived from coal. Refundability of the credit is also addressed in the amendments. The amendments extend the termination date for excise tax credits for liquid fuel derived from coal to December 31, 2020. The effective date for these changes is after September 30, 2006.
